website_summaries.verdict: Sennheiser's HD238 headphones sound excellent for the price, with rich bass response and crisp highs housed in a comfortable design.
cons: Can be overly sibilant on some vocals

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones..Amazing sound..but
customer_reviews.text: No doubt these are wonderfully sounding headphones. The problem I had was using a sansa fuze and a Fiio e6 amp the headphones would cut out or clip when turned up too loud. I've never had headphones do this..I use Sennheiser px-100, Metro Fi 220s, Panasonic RP-HT600s(get a pair of these if you can..worth it to add for the price..they are great cans) and none cut out..or pop..I think it's called clipping..but these do really bad.. This is just my experience with this setup. They do sound amazing at normal volume. I give it 5 stars for sound..just didn't work for my setup I suppose..
customer_reviews.author: Thomas S

customer_reviews.title: Fan-Fracking-Tastic!
customer_reviews.text: I have been a Sennheiser customer since the HD414 days LONG ago. Loved the 414 and 424s for great sound and ultra light weight and comfort. These are certainly a worthy successor of that legacy. Very light weight and comfortable and the sound blew me away when I put them on. I have LOTS of headphones. With 12-14 hour days, I have to change what is on my head once or twice a day. These will probably last much longer than most. The ear cushions could be a little larger, the cord could use some more beef,but they are the best first impression headphones I have put on in decades.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Harbath

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, Great sound
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a very light set of headset that doesn't seal over your ear, drowning out ambient noise and this is just what I wanted. It does allow for sounds around you to be heard, but the clarity of the sounds from the headset is great. If you are looking for a headset that isolates the sound to only that which comes from the headset, this is not for you. It's comfortable, and offers great clarity in sound. I would recommend to people like me, who want to be able to hear everything around you, but at the same time, enjoy music at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: ECH

customer_reviews.title: Phenomenal!  I think I got my hearing back!
customer_reviews.text: I listen to classic rock music on my Mac with Altec-Lansing speakers with a subwoofer. I often have to suppress the bass and volume so as not to disturb others at home. I decided to get headphones but knew I did not want over-the-ear closed headphones due to weight and comfort. I recalled a friend's Sennheiser open-air headphones from the '70's. I am listening to Hendrix right now (I am a huge fan) and hearing details that I haven't been able to perceive in over 30 years. I thought I had lost my high and low range. They are also comfortable. I think these are great and recommend them very highly for both performance and price.
customer_reviews.author: rtcordo

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sound, good comfort
customer_reviews.text: Pretty amazing. I wanted on-the-ear, open headphones, and went with Sennheiser because of past experience with their products. These headphones amazed me with their sound from the very start -- I can't wait until they fully break in. The open design gives strong (but not overpowering) bass, including deep frequencies, and the sound leakage is fairly minor. Plenty of volume on my Android smartphone. Quite comfortable -- leather/felt earpads. They don't collapse like the Bose OE do, but felt more comfortable by far. Only a pouch for protection, not a case, but that should be good enough. And, through a "Fulfilled by Amazon" vendor, less than one-third the cost of the Bose. (Half what Amazon itself was asking!)
customer_reviews.author: kcooper

customer_reviews.title: Okay, but I suspect there are better for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these headphones to back up and eventually replace the ones that came with my Panasonic Cassette tape players (I sure wish they still made those). The sound is good and they are reasonably comfortable; however, the Panasonic headphones that came with the player are better. It is perhaps an unfair comparison because those Panasonic headphones were superb compared with those of any price. Anyway, these Sennheisers will do, although I suspect there are better ones for less money.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Roof

customer_reviews.title: Worked for 1 hour
customer_reviews.text: For the one hour these headphones actually worked, they sounded pretty good. Unfortunately, an hour into my very first session, the left channel goes out. Ironic part is the single headphone cable goes into the LEFT CHANNEL. So you'd figure both would cut out. I still own a PX-100 set and absolutely love them, but just as the PX-100 II, Sennheiser quality seems to be tumbling. I would suggest looking at other brands (as I have)
customer_reviews.author: macman

customer_reviews.title: I love these headphones
customer_reviews.text: Confortable, very good sound. Sometimes, the low notes sound more clear than high ones, but overall they're fine. Paired with a Fiio e6 they sound pretty cool, both lows and highs (and mids also). Also, being open you can wear them and have a conversation with someone (if you use them with a moderate volume). Sounds come in, but very few goes out. It will only be heard in the surroundings if they are at high volume in a really silent environment. Got them refurbished for less than 20 bucks. Wouldn't mind paying the price of a new pair.
customer_reviews.author: ralph__86

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and excellent sound
customer_reviews.text: Very nicely designed and has good sound quality. As they are over-ear headphones they give very less noise cancellation for outdoor use. They also leak sound so person next to your might be disturbed. But this was never meant to be a noise canceling headphones, go for other models which are specifically designed to it. It has a very clear and crisp sound and are light to wear. It has a good head cushion and doesn't mess up your hair. I can listen to music for extended hours w\o any discomfort. A good value for money.
customer_reviews.author: Purnachandra

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for headphones in the Apple store and I came across these. They sound great! Maybe I am not the greatest audiophile out there, but I bought them based on what I heard and felt (soft and comfy without the phones squeezing my head). Amazon was cheaper by $19, so obviously I bought them here. All I can say is, so far it has been better than the Sony, JVC, and all the previous Sennheisers I own.
customer_reviews.author: Don D.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!!
customer_reviews.text: Wow, I bought these at the suggestion of my 21 YO son,after wasting countless dollars on cheap stuff. I listen to all my music on an iPod. Well it is true you get what you pay for. In this case you get MORE than you pay for,Really. I'm an older Dude who listens to everything from Evanescence to Clapton to Government Mule and everything in between. The Bass is awesome. The mids and highs are also top Notch. They are very comfortable and well made. Unless you have super sonic hearing, your search ends here.
customer_reviews.author: CA

customer_reviews.title: They fall off
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality is great but they don't fit me well. I have them on the smallest size possible and it's not small enough. My hat size is 7 1/8. Also the ears only rotate one way so I have to wear the right side on my left ear to get them to fit comfortably. If you are using them to watch TV and you have a larger than 7 1/8 head I think they are a great buy for the price.
customer_reviews.author: HelloAmazon

customer_reviews.title: Good but cord breaks too often
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time but man this headphone terminates to a straight plug which I found out is really bad. I keep my iPod in my pocket while I'm listening to it and every time I bend over, or basically lift my leg, the straight plug wears down a bit. Eventually it will break and you will have to find a replacement for your headphones Don't get me wrong, these are good headphones if you're getting them for under $50 but man the straight plug just ruins everything for me
customer_reviews.author: T.C.

customer_reviews.title: Better than my Bose OE1's
customer_reviews.text: Okay, these cans are the best for me. I tried Bose OE's and they sounded muddled even after the 30 hour break-in mark. When I received the HD238's the sound blew me away. I was actually smiling and enjoying listening to my music and movies thru these cans. I cannot stress that the sounds that come from these are amazing. My Bose OE are now my backup pair. Hopefully these last at least a couple of years. So to anyone who is considering purchasing these you won't be dissappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Concerned but loving them for now
customer_reviews.text: The first pair arrived DOA. I sent them via a warranty claim back to Sennheiser and was pleasantly surprised how fast it was turned around with a new pair. The sound is amazing. Heavy on bass which is easy to EQ down for the purist. Great over all sound. My daughter loves using them on her DSi. Light weight and comfortable for any size person from 6 yrs and up.
customer_reviews.author: wtc

customer_reviews.title: Great entry level headphones
customer_reviews.text: I have been using these headphones for several years they worked great although I have been behaving rough to them (dropping, throwing, sitting on them). They are still working great, and the sound is so good I realized it after I bought some other headphones.
customer_reviews.author: kizilsakal

customer_reviews.title: Nice and comfortable headphones
customer_reviews.text: Nice. Comfortable and plenty of headroom where the volume is concerned. Only questionable thing is there is no volume control on the headphones, but this is a small consideration. I am more interested in how they sound, and these sound great.
customer_reviews.author: raarset

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable but a bit Bass-heavy
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a "headphone of the month" promotion, these Sennheisers are quite good - clearly a step up from my old HD414s which, following needed replacement foam ear pads, are a bit lacking in bass. These HD-238s are really comfortable even when fitted snugly and the sound is good, though I think they are a bit bass-heavy. They appear to be quite sturdy as well. A couple of quibbles: the cord is a bit short, and ends in a mini phone plug - clearly Sennheiser has aimed these headphones toward the MP3 player crowd. For the price (and quality), Sennheiser should have seen fit to include a mini phone plug to standard phono plug adapter for home listening.
customer_reviews.author: JBrad

customer_reviews.title: Sound quality is good; Feel comfortable; List price is too high
customer_reviews.text: I got the refurbished for USD25. Sound quality is good. Base is strong; High is not crisp and is weak; Overall sound and build quality are good for USD25, but it is not worth what it lists USD140 or even the "on sale" USD67.
customer_reviews.author: BGee

customer_reviews.title: 4.5 out 5 if I could!
customer_reviews.text: These will not cancel out surrounding noise but they are GREAT! Especially for the price! I use them at work and have tried my co-workers Beats by Dre Solo HD and could honestly say these are comparable. The only reason I didn't give these 5 out of 5 is because I feel the bass is a little too deep when you crank up the volume. Otherwise, great headphones!
customer_reviews.author: Jacksonu

customer_reviews.title: Awesome sound..
customer_reviews.text: I have been searching for a nice pair of headphones that didn't hurt my ears, and didn't cost $200. After researching these I decided to try them and I'm glad I did. I love them!!!! I don't even want to let my husband use them.. lol
customer_reviews.author: L. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Audiophile Portable Headphone
customer_reviews.text: Very impresed with the unit, its look light and fragile,the cable is thin,1/8 cable connector is weak, more robust material will put this unit as a steal. The sound is what take the headphone apart, easily destroy the Bose type sound (i have a Bose headphone), the key? balance and clarity across the audio spectrum. Good recorded cd, lessloss mp3 of clasic, new age and instrumental music, with the HD 238 connected to a good dac (Audioengine d1) an you can get audiophile quality sound from any computer.
customer_reviews.author: macord3ro

customer_reviews.title: High quality for a good price.
customer_reviews.text: Person bought multiple sets of these for around $40. They sound great for the price and are highly recommended. Sennheiser is know for headsets.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Cho

customer_reviews.title: sennheiser hd 238
customer_reviews.text: Great headphones. Very happy with the quality. Nice rich bass and clear mid ranges. Been an avid Sennheiser fan for many years. This one does not disappoint either.
customer_reviews.author: Aikaterini Varsou

customer_reviews.title: Great for price
customer_reviews.text: sound quality is great. problem would be that people around can hear it too... but for it's price, it was a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: T. Liu

customer_reviews.title: Use for jogging or other outdoor exercise
customer_reviews.text: For those of you who don't like earbuds and who exercise outdoors and want to be able to hear your surroundings, this is a great pair of open air over the ear headphones. I run with these regularly and while they are bigger than the P100's and P200s, both of which I have used in the past and liked, these are super comfortable and sound really crisp. I use these for watching movies on ipad etc. and at work so they are versatile as well.
customer_reviews.author: christiinmb

customer_reviews.title: could be better
customer_reviews.text: The cord is thinner than the ear-bud cord that comes standard with the I-pod. Lets see how long this will last. It does nothing for noise cancelling. This is not a loud pair of headphones by any means. All this being said, they sound great and feel even better. You can feel the bass.
customer_reviews.author: phishead

customer_reviews.title: eh
customer_reviews.text: It's ok.......not as good as my Bose OE headphones, but they do the job. They don't fold as nicely as I hoped making it more difficult to travel with, and the flimsy bag that comes with them won't offer enough protection while traveling. But I bought them at 1/2 price so I can't complain too much.
customer_reviews.author: Xigua

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones
customer_reviews.text: Xmas gift for my son, who uses them daily. Great sound, comfortable and lightweight. I wanted to get a pair for myself, but they're not being made anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Jalbert

customer_reviews.title: Best Headphones for my iPod
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are amazing! They are so comfortable. The sound quality is outstanding. I like them better than the Bose On-Ear headphones for sound and comfort. They make my music on my ipod come alive and seem very realistic. I could not be happier with these. Great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: D. Nelson

customer_reviews.title: A+
customer_reviews.text: Have been searching for the perfect set of headphones to wear at work-- I've found them. Fantastic sound, zero listening fatigue, balanced range, and unlike noise-cancelling buds, you're not isolated from what's going on around you. Have gone through 5 different sets trying to meet this criteria; these are the ones.
customer_reviews.author: M.

customer_reviews.title: Sennheiser HD238 Open Aire Stereo Headphone
customer_reviews.text: The Senneiser HD238 earphones were a gift. They are comfortable and offer really fine audio entertainment with my iPod. Th ear phones have been a welcome addition to my iPod listening enjoyment.
customer_reviews.author: J.D.

customer_reviews.title: good sound for inexpensive headphones
customer_reviews.text: Nice sound for comparatively cheap headphones. I like the one wire instead of two, much more manageable. Good buy for very good sound when you're "on the go." REALLY needs a right-angle plug. Keep coming out of my phone.
customer_reviews.author: Paul M. Bauer

customer_reviews.title: Rocking my world (Get it?)
customer_reviews.text: Just arrived today and so far so GREAT! So comfortable and the sound coming from these lightweight headphones is amazing. They feel very strong and durable. Great product and I am very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: HeyAGinger

customer_reviews.title: perfect for me !!
customer_reviews.text: 1. the bass is really umppppphhhhhhh !!!! 2. surround sound ! 3. sound is really clear 4. very100000000000000000 comfortable . you don't any pain on your ear even after a long wear buy this product . you wouldn't lose anything .
customer_reviews.author: alvinston21

customer_reviews.title: Tried it. Didn't love it.
customer_reviews.text: Tried these as I have had good experience with other Sennheisers (P 200) but these just didn't impress. Maybe they need to be "broken in" with some burning in. I'm not a techie audiophile but the musical instruments just don't sound "real" to me. My best 'phones? my Klipsch S4s earbuds. I'll keep them and hope they get better.
customer_reviews.author: Saul Nathanson

customer_reviews.title: Ends justify the means
customer_reviews.text: I love them !! perfect size for mp3's and computers. If want to spend more then this for a beter sound you might get, but you are also paying for the name as well. These head phones are perfect, good size, price and souund !!

customer_reviews.title: Sennheiser Headphone
customer_reviews.text: Tired of using ear buds for my infrequent uses of music and videos while traveling,etc. I researched for a few weeks for the best for me headphones and found it. This product is perfect for me, lightweight with great comfort and sound.
customer_reviews.author: Sonata

customer_reviews.title: Sounds Great But Wire Too Thin
customer_reviews.text: These headphones sound great but the cable wire too thin. After a very short time the wire broke the connection to the left ear-cup.
customer_reviews.author: James Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Loved them for a month.
customer_reviews.text: and then the right ear driver died while I listened to music... Pros: I liked this headphones. They sounded great after a good burn-in (the sound out of the box is a little muffled). They look nice. "Seems" well built. Cons: Leaks a lot (I know they're open headphones, but still, the sound leakage is way louder then other open headphones). Lasted one month and died (the right ear driver itself, not the cord or connectors). Did I mention they died after 1 month?
customer_reviews.author: B.Rock

customer_reviews.title: No
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy these, the wire BROKE after 3 months, and I treat them well. Great sound quality, but, really?! $120 for a product that will break quicker than the $10 pair you can get at walmart.
customer_reviews.author: Kali

customer_reviews.title: when it works it works well, unfortunately it doesn't always work.
customer_reviews.text: The right ear goes in and out. When I first got it it went out then started working so I didn't send it back now I wish I had.
customer_reviews.author: P. McDaniels

customer_reviews.title: Great Headphones
customer_reviews.text: These are by far the best deal that i have gotten in a longtime. I used to own a pair of bose but when they broke i was looking for a new pair of less expensive headphones. These headphones are so comfortable you dont even feel them. I highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: fusion0592

customer_reviews.title: Sennheiser HD238
customer_reviews.text: This is a great pair of headphones. Definitely comfortable and light. Sound quality is great, bass is decent. Only problem is that, as many others have mentioned, the cord is too thin.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Sennheiser the Best
customer_reviews.text: I had a pair of Sennheiser headphones that I left in a motel room many years ago. I have have not found a pair as good as those until now. These are terrific-great bass but not overwhelming, very good midrange and treble.
customer_reviews.author: apluspest

customer_reviews.title: great headphones too bad they break so fast
customer_reviews.text: these headphones were great sounding, maybe even amazing bass was amazing and sounded natural but the day after i got them the right ear just stopped working
customer_reviews.author: hworang

customer_reviews.title: Amazing.
customer_reviews.text: I do not regret this purchase at all. Very comfortable lightweight headphones. The sound is amazing and the build quality is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Connor

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Light, strongly built, very comfortable and the sound is great for its price range. Very well balanced, good low frequencies with clear mids and highs.
customer_reviews.author: HeitorLN

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Great headphones. They sound about the same as the Bose on-ear headphones they have on display with the iPods at the Apple store, but they're about $100 cheaper. Very comfortable. The only drawback I've noticed is that they do not block outside noise very well, so they work better as studio monitors than iPod headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Technojazz

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: Great sound for the price but the headphones are cheap and the earphones blow out easy also you need short hair orelse the headphones will not stay on your head.
customer_reviews.author: lori

customer_reviews.title: awk !! ward
customer_reviews.text: sound quality was ok but felt awkward on my head - these are not over the ear headphones as i assumed but foam padded on the ear type dealies and they were definitely uncomfortable - i returned them and ordered Sennheiser HD 428 from [...] - probly a better deal since they allow full refunds for 30 days if you don't like the product - a good feature if you're buying something without testing it that is going to be subject to subjectivity - hope my 428s are happy
customer_reviews.author: Rohn S. Bayes

customer_reviews.title: A little disappointing
customer_reviews.text: These were fine overall and we got such a good deal on them that we are mostly happy with the purchase. However we were disappointed that anyone within earshot of you can hear what you are listening to, albeit muffled. Kinda negates the whole point of headphones.
customer_reviews.author: nymorningstar

customer_reviews.title: Quality you say?!
customer_reviews.text: Right ear piece died after 8 month of low usage(5-10 hours a week). It has high impedance so the volume is really low, you'll need to set your volume to max in mobile devices and it's a good chance it will not be enough.
customer_reviews.author: a.x.

customer_reviews.title: My best headphones
customer_reviews.text: this is my best headphones i ever had, i like the bass very much. i use it to watch movie on my pc, music on ithouch and my ipad2. the sound is great !!! thanks amazon..cheaper than any stores in indonesia..
customer_reviews.author: Afan

customer_reviews.title: A short love story
customer_reviews.text: When I used the headphones for first time I was very happy, the sound was great. The only one detail was I heared the cars's noice in the street, then I had to use the volume in max, but in resume I was happy with the headphones. One week later, the left headphone died and the love story ended. One week, only one week!!!, I want back my money.
customer_reviews.author: COSTY

customer_reviews.title: Nice product
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for our teenage son to use with his ipod touch. He said they work really good and are comfortable to wear. Glad I found these on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: great sound  bad product
customer_reviews.text: These headphones were awful the sound was great but the earpiece came off constantly. I would not recommend them to use when you work out. The earpiece came off after about three months, the company replaced the earpiece and those came off after one month.
customer_reviews.author: JohnF

customer_reviews.title: head phones are not as quiet as I'd hoped
customer_reviews.text: These head phones were too expensive for the noise that comes from them as the wearer listens to the music. The headphones are nice and cushy and fit really well so that was good.
customer_reviews.author: H. Clanton

customer_reviews.title: sennheiser hd238
customer_reviews.text: I just purchased these headphones; oh man they'are so overrated: 1. very low bass, 2. very thin cable; won't last a month though comfortable on my head. Wouldn't recommend these!!
customer_reviews.author: senn_hd238

product_meta.title: Sennheiser HD 238 Open Aire Stereo Headphones - (Discontinued by Manufacturer)
product_meta.description:
Enjoy elegantly curved style and high-quality, lifelike stereo sound with the Sennheiser HD 238 headphones, which feature Sennheiser's advanced Open-Aire acoustic system with powerful neodymium magnets and lightweight diaphragms. Stylish with an elegant black over-ear design, the HD 238 fits all the ways you work and play.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
 Sennheiser HD 238 

 In addition to timeless design and classic style, the HD 238 headphones offer a high-quality, life-like, stereo sound experience courtesy of Sennheiser's advanced Open-Aire acoustic system. You will not believe that such a wide, expansive sound-stage can come out of such a compact headphone. After hearing one, you too will be a believer in true sound.

 * Superb detail and bass response 
 * Open-Aire speakers for jaw dropping sound 
 * Amazing audiophile quality sound in a portable format

Learn more about the HD 238 Precision The HD 238's Open-Aire speaker design is used to achieve the highest sound quality, fidelity and representation of frequency response in close proximity to the ear. (does not block sound...for the serious audiophile)



Features  * Advanced Open-Aire acoustic system 
 * Carrying pouch included for easy storage and protection 
 * Fold-flat design travels easily 
 * Premium metallic components and exchangeable earpads for superior performance and durability 
 * Optimised for iPod, iPhone, MP3 and CD players (iPhone and iPod are trademarks of Apple Inc., registered in the U.S. and other countries.) 
 * Built-tough with a 2 Year warranty 
 * Compatible (listen only) with latest generation of tablets 

Did you know?  These headphones feature premium metallic components and exchangeable earpads for superior performance and durability.

Sennheiser recommends these headphones for ... ... the serious audiophile that wants true sound in a compact, light-weight, portable solution.

Compatibility Compatible (listen only) with latest generation of tablets and mobile devices with an 1/8"(3.5mm) jack.

Warranty 2-year international warranty. Sennheiser's worldwide service network will provides smooth handling of any case of warranty that might occur.

Meet the range 

HD 218 HD 238 HD Precision HD 238i Frequency Response 19 - 21,000 Hz 16 - 23,000 Hz 16 - 23,000 Hz Impedance 24 ohms 32 ohms 32 ohms Sound pressure level (SPL) 108 dB 114 dB 114 dB Speaker syetem Closed Open Open Transducer principle Dynamic Dynamic Dynamic Connector 1/8 (3.5mm) 1/8 (3.5mm) 1/8 (3.5mm) i series Volume control N/A N/A In-line Microphone mute N/A N/A In-line Warranty 2 years 2 years 2 years Why Sennheiser? For over 60 years every Sennheiser mic or headphone comes with a built-in mission: to stay true to the sound and soul the music was given by its artist. From the fragile intimacy of a whispered word to the deep and dark punch of an attacking bassline. Sennheiser delivers pure emotion and excitement. A quality that has convinced a broad spectrum of artists and of course music lovers all over the world. Sennheiser offers a great experience for everyone who really wants to hear.

What's in the box?  * HD 238 Precision
 * Carrying pouch
feature_bullets: Advanced acoustic system with powerful neodymium magnets and lightweight diaphrams for lifelike stereo sound experience.
Premium metallic compnents and exchangeable earpads for superior performance and durability
Carrying pouch included for easy storage and protection
Optimised for iPod, iPhone, MP3 and CD players
